snippet.title: Diamonds netball rivals opt for new blood
snippet.content:
NEW Zealand netball coach Janine Southby has opted to give young talent a go in the lead-up to the Silver Ferns' bid to dethrone Australia as Commonwealth Games champions. Southby has selected two debutants and recalled an older player to the Silver Ferns squad ahead of the two upcoming international series and the Commonwealth Games on the Gold Coast in February.
While there are plenty of familiar faces, including Katrina Grant, Maria Tutaia and Bailey Mes, midcourter Whitney Souness and shooter Monica Falkner have earned their first Silver Ferns call-ups with defender Temalisi Fakahokotau, who last played for the Silver Ferns in 2014, earning a recall. The upcoming Quad series against Australia, England and South Africa will be the first since Australia formed its own domestic competition - Super Netball - which replaced the trans-Tasman League played by both Australian and New Zealand clubs until this season.
"This is a crucial time for us as we countdown to the Gold Coast Commonwealth Games in April," Southby said in a statement on Monday. "Our upcoming matches against Australia, South Africa and England will provide further opportunities for us to build combinations and expose players to the intensity of Test match netball.
"There is some exciting, young talent coming through and we've seen them stand up and consistently deliver under pressure in the ANZ Premiership and at Netball World Youth Cup. Now we'll get the opportunity to test them on the international stage." The Silver Ferns open their international season in Brisbane on August 26 with a match against South Africa in the netball Quad Series. Silver Ferns team for Netball Quad Series against Australia, England and South Africa: Gina Crampton, Shannon Francois, Katrina Grant, Kelly Jury, Phoenix Karaka, Bailey Mes, Te Paea Selby-Rickit, Samantha Sinclair, Whitney Souness (on debut), Maria Tutaia, Jane Watson, Maia Wilson Silver Ferns team for Taini Jamison Trophy against England: Kayla Cullen, Gina Crampton, Temalisi Fakahokotau, Monica Falkner (on debut), Shannon Francois, Katrina Grant, Kelly Jury, Bailey Mes, Grace Rasmussen, Te Paea Selby-Rickit, Maria Tutaia, Jane Watson Originally published as
